header.title: The Scroll of Set
header.category: Western Esotericism, Occultism, Setianism, Magical Practice

central_thesis: This issue of The Scroll of Set explores the core Setian philosophies of Xeper and Transformation through practical magical applications, addressing both individual self-realization and collective efforts to navigate and influence a rapidly changing world. It emphasizes the importance of conscious self-becoming, critical thinking in the face of societal decay, and the unique ethical and communal aspects of the Temple of Set as distinct from other occult traditions.

structure_content.summary: Administrative update announcing a new mailing address for the Executive Director, Ms. Linda Reynolds, and providing strict instructions for proper mail correspondence to ensure receipt and maintain discretion.

Proposes a mass Setian working on July 18/19 focused on 'Transformation' to collectively 'push' for change in people, events, and paradigms. It discusses the accelerating pace of global change and the Setian imperative to embrace transformation, likening the collective effort to a 'meta-experiment' utilizing individual magic.

Outlines a 36-day magical exercise designed to uncover the 'Hidden' self and access forgotten memories. Practitioners use a concealed spiral notebook for daily journaling about intentional life changes and puzzling subconscious actions/dreams, culminating in a ritual to clarify personal identity and future aspirations.

Provides guidelines and considerations for using the Temple's Inter-Communication Roster (ICR), stressing the importance of active two-way dialogue, accurate self-description, and patience when corresponding with higher-degree Initiates, while also humorously critiquing ineffective ICR entries.

structure_content.chapter_title: [5] Starry Wisdom Church to be Saved
structure_content.summary: Reports on the successful efforts to save St. John's Church in Providence, Rhode Island, the setting for H.P. Lovecraft's 'The Haunter of the Dark,' from demolition, highlighting its preservation as a literary landmark.

Offers a technical framework for documenting and designing magical rituals, detailing essential components such as time, purpose, working style, setup (altar, objects, elements), sequence of actions, invocations, and recording the results, thoughts, and feelings.

Discusses the strategic choice for Setians, particularly in Australia, to identify publicly with Setianism/Satanism to dispel misconceptions and proactively defend their right to practice their religion against potential legal restrictions.

structure_content.chapter_title: [8] Fight Fire with Fire, Stiffness with ...
structure_content.summary: A brief, humorous note connecting sex, adrenal glands, cortisone, and relief of pain/swelling, presented as a 'news item' relevant to health.

A poetic, evocative piece exploring the perilous journey towards the 'Unholy Graal' and desired 'nectar,' questioning the fear of poison and implying a transformative, divine process involving mortality and self-discovery.

A personal narrative describing an Initiate's journey to discovering Set and the Temple of Set through occult studies, culminating in a realization of kinship and a commitment to advancing the Æon through Xeper, driven by love and the desire for self-Becoming.
A concise, defiant quote attributed to Sam Giancana, responding to a question about his Christian faith with dismissive brevity, underscoring a non-conformist stance.

Advises Setians to utilize local college and public libraries, especially through InterLibrary Loan, as a primary resource for obtaining obscure occult texts, exemplified by finding 'The King in Yellow' through this method.

A powerful, vampiric poetic declaration of individual godhood and self-creation ('I am Nosferatu'). It describes drawing power from internal darkness, traversing the 'Jeweled Gate,' and asserting absolute will within the 'Æon of Set' to achieve Xeper and Remanifestation.

Examines the role of political thinking for Setians, arguing it's necessary for self-knowledge and defining ideas to impact the world. It posits that societal breakdown could benefit Setians who cultivate 'Troth' (loyal support structures) and bring about cultural change, defining 'evil' as preventing a psyche from finding the real.

Details the upcoming Set-XIII Conclave, including registration logistics, sponsorship requirements for I° Initiates, types of activities (workshops, rituals, presentations), and the importance of advance planning. It portrays Conclaves as unique gatherings where collective Workings yield profound results.

Critiques the contemporary world as a 'Dark Age' of decay and neo-barbarism, contrasting it with the Temple of Set's founding environment. It highlights the changing nature of initiation inquiries (from contemplation to desperation) and asserts that the Temple's ultimate battle is individual self-perfection, not societal reform.

Reviews the film adaptation of H.P. Lovecraft's 'The Case of Charles Dexter Ward,' praising its horror but criticizing its simplification compared to the intricate source novel, which loses nuances of the original's 'Setian' character, Joseph Curwen.

Presents the Temple of Set's ethical stance on abortion, asserting that an individual's body is their own business. It distinguishes 'living human tissue' from a 'human person' (defined by a functioning brain developing later in pregnancy), arguing that 'killing' an unborn child is not applicable to early fetuses from a Setian perspective.

Updates on Anton LaVey's ongoing legal and financial troubles, including bankruptcy proceedings to avoid a judgment for Diane Hegarty. It details the deteriorating state of the Church of Satan headquarters and questions LaVey's reported income and the CoS's financial operations.

Announces the digitization of archive documents, including Pylon and Order newsletters, for the Glinda (Crystal Tablet file directory), facilitating access for Setians. It encourages contributors to provide clear, printed copies for scanning and mentions a master-index in progress.

A personal account of research into occult themes, initiated by 'Raiders of the Lost Ark,' using various government and academic libraries. The author describes how an initial Scroll article evolved into fictional stories for the Priesthood, which later gained an unsettling basis in a 'real' event, subsequently denied by a Priest.

key_concepts.definition: The core Setian process of individual self-creation, transformation, and becoming. It signifies the conscious, willed evolution of the self, beyond pre-existing definitions, embracing both internal and external changes.

A fundamental theme in Setian magic, referring to a type of profound change (individual, group, societal) that Setians can 'push' through mass application of their individual magics. It's an active process of altering paradigms and worldviews.

A concept explored through operative magic, focusing on self-discovery, accessing the 'Hidden' aspects of one's being, and understanding the patterns of intentional life changes. It is a path to becoming wiser and more powerful through introspection.

A symbolic or actual manifestation of individual divinity, the intrinsic spark of unique consciousness within a Setian. It is invoked and recognized in rituals as a source of power and self-realization.

A term used to describe a large-scale, potentially long-term magical working or series of workings, where individual Setians apply their unique magics concurrently to achieve a collective, overarching influence on reality, beyond individual gains.

A magical principle suggesting that direct focus on a desired outcome can obscure it; instead, a slightly indirect or peripheral approach allows the true focus to come into view. Applied to self-discovery and collective workings, implying that indirect means can yield profound insights.

A word associated with Runa, denoting the establishment of loyal support structures or personal networks. These are built on a real exchange of value within society, providing resources for Setians in both stable and disintegrating social environments.
A specific epoch or historical period characterized by the emergence, influence, and advancement of Setian philosophy, power, and the conscious evolution of individuals within the Temple of Set.

Distinguished from 'living human tissue.' According to medical science cited, a 'human person' requires a minimally functioning brain, which does not develop until well into the second trimester of pregnancy or later. This definition underpins the Setian stance on abortion ethics.
Defined as 'Anything that prevents a psyche from finding the real.' This relative value emphasizes hindrances to individual self-discovery and empowerment rather than external moral codes.

practical_system.description: This issue outlines several practical frameworks for Setian magic, focusing on individual self-transformation, conscious engagement with change, and the strategic application of will. The systems emphasize introspection, journaling, and collective magical intent to influence both subjective and objective realities. The 'Operant Magic of Runa II' serves as a structured, personal working for self-discovery and accessing hidden aspects of the psyche, while the proposed 'Mass Setian Celebration' aims for a synchronized, collective magical effort towards global transformation. Ritual recording guidelines also provide a framework for systematic magical practice and analysis.
tools: Black cloth (to conceal the Runa II notebook)
Altar (for ritual focus, particularly in Runa II)
Black Flame (symbolic or actual focal point in rituals)
Pencil and paper (for journaling, ritual notes, and general documentation)
Inter-Communication Roster (ICR) (for networking and communication within the Temple)
Libraries and InterLibrary Loan (for research and occult study materials)
rituals: Mass Setian Celebration (July 18/19, midnight) focused on Transformation: Individual Setians simultaneously apply their unique magics to 'push' for change in people, events, and paradigms.

Operant Magic of Runa II Culminating Ritual: Includes opening the Gate, lighting the Black Flame, an Invocation of Set, stating the Third part of the Word of Set (English), and a specific Graal statement for self-clarification and intent.

General Ritual Design and Recording: Encompasses stating time, date, place, purpose, outlining working style, describing setup (altar, objects, music, colors, incense, sigils, light/darkness), detailing the sequence of actions, invocations, and documenting results (thoughts, feelings, desired outcomes, any generated art or references).

relevant_quotes.text: As we follow the multiple paths of personal darkness to that internal realm of Xeper, we are always engaged in the process of transformation. You need only reflect on the changes, internal and external, to your world in the last year to understand the truth of that statement.

The intent of the working is to (1) to give this type of change known as transformation a “push” from many Setians all working their individual magics at the same moment in time; and (2) to actually transform people, events and paradigms/world views through the mass application of magic.

The entries for #1 will begin to show that you've always had more power over your life than you thought, and that you've always been a little wiser than you've imagined. The entries for #2 will show you that there's still a great deal about yourself that you don't know.

I am Nosferatu. My dark desire burns within my black heart like the furnaces of Hades. My 'Black Soma' bubbles across the Akashic membrane from the eternal darkness of my potentiality. And in my eternal darkness is the Jeweled Gate. This only I may traverse. For the mighty Prince of Darkness and I share our realities across that threshold. It is the source: the dark blood of my forever. I drink deeply of its infinity.
Evil - Anything that prevents a psyche from finding the real.

Your body is your body. As such, it's no one else's business what you do with it. If you want to pig out and make it fat, or pump iron until its muscles bulge out, or pierce your ear, or get a tattoo, or not have something independently growing inside you (whether it's cancer, ringworm, or a fetus), that's your decision.
Ultimately the battle is not to be fought in society, nor within any organization such as the Temple of Set. It is an exclusively, intensely individual and personal battle.

The so-called "scientific fact that human life begins at conception” is flatly contradicted by present medical science. One must distinguish between "living human tissue”, which does start developing at conception, and the "life of a human person". Without a functioning brain there is no human person.

critical_analysis.relevance: This issue of The Scroll of Set is highly relevant for practitioners of Western Esotericism and Occultism, particularly those within the Left-Hand Path and Setian traditions. It provides practical methodologies for individual magical development (Xeper, Runa) and encourages a deeper understanding of the self. The contextualization of Setianism against a backdrop of societal decline and the clear articulation of the Temple's ethical stances (e.g., abortion, political engagement) offer valuable insights into its distinct philosophy and operational principles. The emphasis on conscious self-transformation, critical analysis, and community building, while maintaining individuality, resonates with core occult pursuits of self-mastery and external influence.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience is Initiates of the Temple of Set at all degrees, seeking to deepen their understanding and practice of Setian philosophy and magic. It caters to those interested in practical ritual work, personal introspection, community engagement, and the Temple's administrative and ethical positions. Additionally, elements like the guide to library research or the critical analysis of societal trends would appeal to a broader audience of serious occult practitioners interested in the Left-Hand Path, esotericism, and social critique from a magical perspective.
